intro: Anaphalis cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed silverweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, typically covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. Anaphalis cuneifolia is often found in rocky or dry habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
